Compatibility.comm: The card works well with certain routers.

cont.entity_a: Works well with a Netgear dual band router.
cont.entity_b: Works well with both Windows XP and Ubuntu.

Performance.comm: Offers faster speed and extended range.

cont.entity_a: Faster speed and broader coverage for a home network.

cont.entity_b: Provides good speed and range with a compatible D-Link router.

cont.entity_a: Technical support was unhelpful and focused on collecting personal information.
Netgear software causes connection issues; it's better to use Windows control.
CPU usage remains high when the card is plugged in, with no known fix.
The card was not recognized by some machines, leading to a return.
cont.entity_b: The card has compatibility issues with some chipsets, leading to returns.
Some cards do not auto-install on Fedora Linux as described. Works well with Linux distributions and older hardware.
